description:
The crash occurred on a level four lane undivided roadway at a four-leg intersection controlled
                        by a traffic signal. The posted speed limit was 35 MPH (56 KPH). The roadway for Vehicle #2 was
                        slightly curved to the right with a radius of curvature of 1,125 meters. The weather was clear,
                        the roadway dry and it was daylight at the time of this afternoon weekday crash.


                        Vehicle #1, a 1991 Dodge Dynasty, was traveling north in the second straight/left turn lane
                        approaching the intersection. Vehicle #2, a 1992 Mazda 626, was traveling south in the right
                        hand lane approaching the same intersection. Both vehicles had a green light. Vehicle #1 stopped
                        waiting for traffic to clear prior to making the left hand turn. Vehicle #1 proceeded to make
                        the left turn and struck Vehicle #2 in its front with front. Vehicle #1 drove off the road into
                        a driveway. Vehicle #2 continued a short distance and came to rest facing in a southerly
                        direction in its original lane. Vehicle #2 was towed due to damage. Police did not consider
                        either alcohol or drugs to be involved and ordered no tests.


                        The Dodge Dynasty (Vehicle #1) was driven by a belted 71 year old female who had a bruise to her
                        right forearm from the deployed airbag, but refused treatment. She stated that she was on an
                        errand for her grandson at her anticipated destination. She stated that she had stopped waiting
                        for traffic to clear before making the left, thought she had a green light at the time as she
                        made the turn. As she proceeded to make the turn, she indicated that she saw the other vehicle
                        “out of the corner of her eye” at the last second, but the other vehicle was “right there” and
                        she was unable to avoid the crash. She also stated that she had just accelerated from a stop and
                        was traveling no more than 5-10 MPH. She indicated that the other vehicle was traveling pretty
                        fast and that she never saw her until she was right there.


                        The Critical Precrash Event for Vehicle #1 was that this vehicle was traveling, turning left at
                        the intersection. The Critical Reason for the Critical Even was inadequate surveillance, failed
                        to look, looked but did not see, a recognition error. This was chosen because the driver stated
                        that she never saw Vehicle #2 until she was right there. An associated factor coded to this
                        driver was the use of prescription and non-prescription medications: (a) a blood pressure
                        medication, (b) a diabetic medication, (c) an asthma medication, (d) a pain reliever and (e) 2
                        unknown additional medications. The driver did not wear corrective lenses nor have a hearing
                        impairment.


                        The Mazda 626 (Vehicle #2) was driven by a belted 32-year-old female who was not injured. She
                        stated, “She pulled in front of me”. No additional information was obtained due to the driver
                        being unable to be contacted or located.


                        The Critical Precrash Event for Vehicle #2 was other vehicle encroachment from opposite
                        direction over left lane line. The Critical Reason for the Critical Event was not coded to this
                        vehicle.
